questions.question: How does Okta's Adaptive MFA improve login security?
choices: By adjusting the required authentication factors based on login context and risk
By disabling MFA on known devices permanently
By only requiring passwords during business hours
By forcing users to change MFA methods daily

questions.question: What feature does Auth0 provide to implement flexible MFA policies?
choices: MFA API and rules engine for contextual MFA enforcement
Hardcoded MFA methods per application
MFA bypass tokens stored in local storage
Automatic MFA deactivation on mobile devices

questions.question: How does WebAuthn enhance MFA compared to traditional methods?
choices: It uses cryptographic credentials bound to the device and origin, resisting phishing
It replaces authentication with QR codes only
It rotates passwords silently
It requires SMS fallback on all devices

questions.question: Which protocol provides built-in support for enforcing MFA during the authentication process?
choices: SAML with AuthnContextClassRef
OAuth with bearer tokens
DNS over HTTPS
IMAP with STARTTLS

questions.question: What is a limitation of SMS-based MFA in identity platforms like Auth0 or Okta?
choices: It is vulnerable to SIM swapping and interception attacks
It cannot be implemented for SAML flows
It forces users to reset their accounts weekly
It disables encryption during transmission

questions.question: In OAuth 2.0 flows, where is MFA most effectively applied?
choices: At the authorization server before token issuance
During client credential exchanges
When refreshing access tokens silently
In the redirect URI validation phase

questions.question: How does Auth0 support passwordless MFA options?
choices: Through biometrics and device-based authenticators integrated with WebAuthn
By emailing users a static code for reuse
By logging users in without any verification
By storing recovery codes in browser cookies

questions.question: Which Okta feature complements MFA to enhance session security?
choices: Device Trust policies ensuring only managed devices can complete login
Weekly mandatory password rotations
Single Sign-On enforced browser resets
Two-factor via email verification only

questions.question: What is an advantage of using FIDO2 for MFA in identity systems?
choices: It enables passwordless logins with strong phishing resistance
It disables session expiration by default
It allows static passwords to be more secure
It requires weekly token reissuance

questions.question: Which identity protocol allows specifying required authentication strengths like MFA?
choices: SAML via AuthnContext
LDAP binds
POP3 sessions
OAuth 1.0 plaintext tokens

questions.question: Which of the following offers the strongest MFA protection?
choices: A text message code
An email verification link
A hardware security key using WebAuthn
A question about your pet's name

questions.question: Why is MFA a critical part of modern identity systems?
choices: It protects accounts even if the password is compromised
It removes the need for passwords
It replaces encryption entirely
It prevents device theft

questions.question: What type of factor is a fingerprint scan in an MFA system?
choices: Something you are
Something you have
Something you like
Something you know

questions.question: How does WebAuthn improve MFA security?
choices: It emails your credentials securely
It stores passwords in the cloud
It uses device-bound credentials that cannot be phished
It replaces the need for browsers

questions.question: Which attack does MFA most effectively mitigate?
choices: Credential theft through phishing
Browser fingerprinting
Distributed denial of service (DDoS)
SQL injection

questions.question: Which of the following offers the strongest MFA protection?
choices: A question about your pet's name
An email verification link
A text message code
A hardware security key using WebAuthn

It replaces encryption entirely
It protects accounts even if the password is compromised
It prevents device theft

questions.question: What type of factor is a fingerprint scan in an MFA system?
choices: Something you like

questions.question: How does WebAuthn improve MFA security?
choices: It uses device-bound credentials that cannot be phished

questions.question: Which of the following offers the strongest MFA protection?
choices: A question about your pet's name
An email verification link
A text message code
A hardware security key using WebAuthn

questions.question: Which of the following is considered a second factor in MFA?
choices: Your username
Your browser history
The website's domain name
A code sent to your mobile device

questions.question: What does multi-factor authentication (MFA) add to a typical login process?
choices: A second layer of verification beyond just a password
A longer password field
A secret question about your childhood
A CAPTCHA every time you log in

questions.question: How does WebAuthn improve MFA security?
choices: It stores passwords in the cloud
It emails your credentials securely
It uses device-bound credentials that cannot be phished
It replaces the need for browsers

questions.question: What could be a sign of an MFA fatigue attack?
choices: You need to verify your email twice
The MFA app crashes during login
Receiving many unexpected MFA prompts in a short time
The login form turns gray

questions.question: Which attack does MFA most effectively mitigate?
choices: Browser fingerprinting
SQL injection
Credential theft through phishing
Distributed denial of service (DDoS)
